quote: Pleasure can be supported by an illusion; but happiness rests upon truth.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

quote: To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Working hard for something we don't care about is called stress: Working hard for something we love is called passion.
author: Simon Sinek

quote: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams! Live the life you've imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: I know of only one duty, and that is to love.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Death is as sure for that which is born, as birth is for that which is dead. Therefore grieve not for what is inevitable.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.
author: Bob Marley

quote: If it is not right, do not do it, if it is not true, do not say it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: What would you do if you weren't afraid?
author: Spencer Johnson

quote: Given the choice between the experience of pain and nothing, I would choose pain.
author: William Faulkner

quote: Trying to predict the future is like trying to drive down a country road at night with no lights while looking out the back window.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: Believe and you're halfway there.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: There are few reasons for telling the truth, but for lying the number is infinite.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

quote: The future is the worst thing about the present.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Big people don't make people feel small.
author: Robin Sharma

quote: Opportunities don't often come along. So, when they do, you have to grab them.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
author: Carol Burnett

quote: Believe nothing you hear, and only one half that you see.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Dreams have only one owner at a time. That's why dreamers are lonely.
author: William Faulkner

quote: By words the mind is winged.
author: Aristophanes

quote: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: If he cannot stop the mind that seeks after fame and profit, he will spend his life without finding peace.
author: Dogen

quote: All religions, arts and sciences are branches of the same tree.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Nothing good ever comes of violence.
author: Martin Luther

quote: You're always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.
author: Richard Bach
